item.title: Mafia: The Old Country to Add Free Ride Mode
item.content:encoded:
Just a week after its release, Mafia: The Old Country is adding a fan-favorite mode to the game for players to try out that many are sure to enjoy.

The game, which received decent reviews from critics and fans, took the story back to its roots in 1900s Sicily. From the start, the game made a point to change many controversial aspects from Mafia 3. The biggest was to return the series to a more linear format, akin to Mafia 1 and 2. Yet, with the returning mode, announced on the game’s official website, that may not be the case.

Free Ride Mode is Coming to Mafia: The Old Country

In a thank you message from the team, Hangar 13 and 2K Games hyped up the future of the gangster series’ fourth entry. To celebrate, the team announced the return of Free Ride mode, which made its debut in Mafia: Definitive Edition. The mode allowed players to ride and drive around the open world and take on a variety of optional missions. Mostly, it serves as a great way to take in the beautiful sceneries, especially now with the Italian countryside. While the game is linear, Free Ride isn’t technically open world like Mafia 3, but it’s a rather interesting addition.

The mode will be available for free at a later date, along with new content for players to enjoy. While details were sparse on the timing and specifics, it does bode well for returning fans. Toward the end, we got some fun statistics on player behavior to look at. For example, 600 million bullets were fired, though only 185 million enemies were hit by them. Regardless of the decent reception, it seems Hangar 13 and 2K Games are planning to stick with the Torrisi family for a while longer.

Are you excited to try out Free Ride mode in Mafia: The Old Country? Let us know what you think down below or in the Insider Gaming forums.

We have a few guides on Mafia: The Old Country, like a trophy list and runtime, so make sure to check those out. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter!

SUBSCRIBE to our newsletter to receive the latest news and exclusive leaks every week! No Spam.

item.title: All Roblox Fix It Up Codes & Rewards—Every August 2025 Active Code
item.content:encoded:
Fix It Up is a Roblox game all about fixing cars after they’ve broken down on the roadside. Here are all the current reward codes this month.

Roblox games come in all shapes and sizes, letting players do a range of odd and fun jobs. So if you’ve ever wanted to be a roadside car mechanic, then now’s your chance to shine.

As with most Roblox games, Fix It Up periodically releases reward codes to help players get ahead. Below, we’ll reveal all the codes for August and also keep track of the expired codes.

All Active Roblox Fix It Up Codes (August 2025)

As of August 2025, here are all the Roblox Fix It Up codes.

Make sure you use them before they expire!

How to Redeem Roblox Fix It Up Codes

To redeem codes, follow the steps below:

  1. Launch Roblox and then the Fix it Up game.
  2. Click on the ‘#’ option on the right of the screen to bring up the codes menu.
  3. Type in the code you want and press “Redeem”.

If the code is still live, you’ll then receive the above reward. However, know that every code can only be used once per player account.

All Expired Roblox Fix It Up Codes

Here are all the expired codes as of August 2025.

Remember, some expired codes do come back in time. This isn’t always the case, but for this reason, it’s always worth giving expired codes a try.

Where to Find New Roblox Fix It Up Codes

Bookmark this page if you want to be first in line when codes are added. That’s because we’ll update it as soon as they come in

You can also join the official Discord channel, which is where the codes are likely to be revealed first.

Are you a fan of car-based Roblox games? Then be sure to check out our Insider Gaming forum, where you can start up some fast and furious discussions.

While you’re enjoying burning rubber in Roblox, check out our code guides for other games, such as ThrottleX, Rensselaer County, and Pressure.

item.title: NASCAR 25 Soundtrack Includes System of A Down, Jelly Roll, And More!
item.content:encoded:
NASCAR 25’s release is less than two months away, and iRacing has released the official soundtrack for the upcoming game.

Featured artists in this year’s game include System of a Down, Killer Mike, Chevelle, Jelly Roll, and more. In addition to the list of songs, iRacing put together a playlist of 25 of the 28 tracks that you can listen to below as well. The three songs not on the playlist are Can’t Count Me Out by Mr. Phelps, Handle My Business by Lit Squad, and Run Quick and Function by The Proletariats.

NASCAR 25 launches on October 14 for PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S. The game’s PC release will come shortly after.

What song on the NASCAR 25 soundtrack stands out most to you? Let us know down below, and take the discussion further in the official Insider Gaming forums.

NASCAR 25 Soundtrack

  • Hypnotize – System of a Down
  • Flirtin’ with Disaster – Molly Hatchet
  • Drivin’ My Life Away – Eddie Rabbitt
  • I Dream – The Dangerous Summer
  • Nobody Knows – Killer Mike ft. Anthony Hamilton
  • Out of the Black – Royal Blood
  • Big Dawgs (featuring Kalmi) – Hanumankind
  • Feel the Pain – Dinosaur Jr
  • Burn It Down – Parker McCollum
  • The Clincher – Chevelle
  • American Bliss – Have Mercy
  • Liar – Jelly Roll
  • Party Like You – The Cadillac Three
  • Awaken – Breaking Benjamin
  • The Finger – Bryce Leatherwood
  • Skin to Skin – Greg Upchurch
  • F With U (Radio Edit) – Ryan James
  • Pulling Teeth – Slow Joy
  • Weight – Stuck Out
  • 7000 Miles (Remix) – Ruby Ibarra
  • Can’t Count Me Out – Mr. Phelps
  • Handle My Business – Lit Squad
  • I Want the Power – RC Carter
  • Whippin – Justin Starling
  • Let’s Go – Black Prez x Kid Something
  • Run Quick and Function – The Proletariats
  • Shipwreck – Letdown
  • Time Bomb – Whiskey Myers
